alert.note: Alert for Mower (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 05 at 7:15PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Mitchell and eastern Mower Counties through 800 PM CDT... At 714 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Brownsdale to near Adams to near Stacyville. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Adams around 720 PM CDT. Grand Meadow around 745 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Meyer, Taopi, County Roads 56 And 5, McIntire, Johnsburg, Highway 218 And County T 40, Dexter, County Roads 4 And 8, Elkton and Bailey. This includes Interstate 90 in Minnesota between mile markers 188 and 201. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for southeastern Minnesota.
